divs: Sighting DetailsWe were waiting for fireworks to start. there were probably 2000 or so people there. we were looking southwest. my three friends who were with me and i saw a reddish orange sphere appear to the south. if i had to guess, i would say it was 10, 15 thousand ft high, probably 35 degrees off the horizon. it slowly moved toward us, maybe a few miles in 5 seconds. it stopped, grew brighter, more intense. it was about 5 or 6 times larger than a star. it stayed stationary for 20 or thirty seconds, varying in intensity. it then drifted away slowly, the direction it came from, about the same distance, then darted east. it moved 3 or 4 miles in less than a second, then seemed to fade away.
